entries.title: ‘Timely and strong’: Zelenskyy welcomes U.S. military aid
entries.description: “I thank President Biden,” said the Ukrainian president, in reference to the recent multi-billion dollar pledge of military support. “I thank the congressmen and all the Americans who appreciate freedom.”

entries.title: Dutch treasure hunters dig for hidden WWII loot
entries.description: A map recently released by the Dutch National Archive is said to show where German soldiers may have stashed gems, gold and jewelry worth millions of dollars, looted from a bank in August, 1944.

entries.title: Drugs, Diana's death and brotherly bombshells: Top takeaways from Prince Harry's memoir
entries.description: Prince Harry took illegal drugs at 17, begged his father not to re-marry and killed 25 Taliban fighters while serving in the British army, according to his

entries.title: Old Nazi map sparks treasure hunt in the Netherlands
entries.description: An old map believed to mark the spot where German soldiers hid treasure worth millions of dollars during World War II sparked the imagination of amateur

entries.title: Israel police arrest 2 teens in attack on Christian cemetery
entries.description: Police in Israel arrested two teenagers Friday who they said vandalized over two dozen Christian graves in a historic Jerusalem cemetery earlier this week.

entries.title: Prominent Kenyan LGBTQ activist 'brutally killed,' local rights group says
entries.description: Kenyan police have discovered the body of a prominent LGBTQ rights campaigner stuffed inside a metal box in the west of the country, local media reported on Fri

entries.title: Soccer fans hopeful ahead of Gulf Cup in Iraqi city of Basra
entries.description: The Gulf Cup, the first international soccer tournament Iraq had hosted in more than four decades is about to kick off in the southern city of Basra.

entries.title: 'Mad Dog' Marcio Freire dies in surfing accident in Nazaré, Portugal
entries.description: Veteran Brazilian surfer Marcio Freire died on Thursday while practicing tow-in surfing on the giant waves in Nazaré on the central coast of Portugal, the

entries.title: All-female team replaces Juan Guaidó as face of Venezuela opposition
entries.description: Venezuela’s opposition has selected an all-female team of mostly unknown exiled former lawmakers to replace the beleaguered Juan Guaidó.

entries.title: Two teens arrested after Christian graves vandalized in Jerusalem cemetery
entries.description: Israeli police said they have arrested two people suspected of vandalizing a Protestant cemetery in Jerusalem earlier in the week.

entries.title: Putin declares 36-hour ceasefire to observe Orthodox Christmas
entries.description: President Vladimir Putin has called for a 36-hour ceasefire in Ukraine for Russian Orthodox Christmas, but the Kremlin has accused Ukraine of not observing the ceasefire and shelling its positions. NBC News’ Matt Bradley explains how Ukrainian President Zelenskyy is reacting about the ceasefire and whether it could signal a longer ceasefire in the future.

entries.title: Italian soccer great Gianluca Vialli dies at 58
entries.description: Gianluca Vialli, the former Italian soccer forward for Sampdoria, Juventus and Chelsea, has died. He was 58.

entries.title: Claiming Christmas is Ukrainians’ latest salvo at Russia
entries.description: By celebrating Christmas on Dec. 25 instead of Jan. 7, some Eastern Orthodox Christians in Ukraine are taking a stand against the Russian invasion.

entries.title: Escaped Mexican cartel kingpin killed after shootout
entries.description: An escaped Mexican cartel kingpin known as "El Neto" died after a shootout, four days after he had fled prison in a violent mass breakout, authorities said.

entries.title: Violence hits Mexican cartel stronghold after arrest of El Chapo's son
entries.description: Sinaloa’s state capital, a stronghold of the cartel by the same name, was filled with roadblocks and gunfire after Mexico's military captured Ovidio Guzmán.

entries.title: Putin's Orthodox Christmas cease-fire begins, but Ukraine and its allies reject what they see as a cynical ploy
entries.description: Ukraine rejected the cease-fire ordered unilaterally by Russian President Vladimir Putin, which began Friday to coincide with the start of Orthodox Christmas.

entries.title: Zelenskyy says Putin's Christmas cease-fire plan is just a ploy
entries.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Russia was seeking a truce for the Orthodox Christmas holiday to use as a cover to stop Ukrainian advances in the eastern Donbas region and bring in more men and equipment.

entries.title: Hong Kong to resume hamster imports a year after mass cull over Covid
entries.description: Hong Kong is lifting a ban on commercial imports of hamsters, a year after it ordered more than 2,000 to be culled in an effort to stamp out the coronavirus.

entries.title: Prince Harry’s new book drops bombshells about royal family
entries.description: Leaks from Prince Harry’s new book reveal stunning new details about the royal family and Prince William’s criticism of Meghan Markle, among other allegations. Buckingham Palace has yet to comment. NBC News’ Keir Simmons shares more about the bombshell book.

entries.title: Funeral for Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI held at the Vatican
entries.description: At the Vatican, tens of thousands descended on St. Peter’s Square today to mourn Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI. NBC News’ Molly Hunter shares more details on the funeral.
